page.title: 01Rural Hampshire - Village
page.content: The area is downland with gently rolling hills and plenty of trees, many of them beech. The soil is chalk with flints and an occasional clay cap. Water meadows follow the river valley and one area has been designated an area of special scientific interest. The river is noted for trout and watercress. Thatched cottages and narrow twisting toads are a feature. Titchborne itself has a church and public house but no other amenities except one bus a week. It is a farming area; some beef cattle and a herd of milking cows but mainly cereal crops and some hay and silage. The area is networked with footpaths and bridleways. A few people are employed on the farms but most seek employment elcewhere and private transport is necessary, The nearest shops and schools are nearly
